data.title: UNO checker
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

n = int(input())
before = None
e = 0
for i in range(n):
    inputs = input().split()
    v = int(inputs[0])
    c = inputs[1]
    if before != None:
        if before[0] != v and before[1] != c:
            e += 1
    before = (v,c)


# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

if e==0:
    print("Correct")
else :
    print("Incorrect:"+str(e))
data.statement:
Given a UNO discard pile, you have to check that the cards have been played correctly.
Each card is defined by a number and a color. You can play a card on top of another one only if these two cards have the same color or the same number.

testCases.title: Okay
testCases.testIn:
8
4 blue
7 blue
7 yellow
7 green
0 green
1 green
1 green
1 red

testCases.title: Okay
testCases.testIn:
9
4 yellow
4 blue
8 blue
8 green
0 green
0 yellow
0 red
5 red
5 yellow

testCases.title: Color Change
testCases.testIn:
7
5 red
4 red
7 red
8 blue
9 blue
9 green
0 green

testCases.title: Color Change
testCases.testIn:
6
9 green
7 yellow
4 yellow
3 blue
4 blue
4 red

testCases.testIn:
11
0 blue
1 blue
4 blue
4 red
6 red
9 green
9 yellow
8 yellow
0 yellow
3 red
3 red

testCases.title: Cheater
testCases.testIn:
10
1 blue
8 blue
6 blue
9 yellow
6 red
5 red
2 green
2 green
7 green
7 blue

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read v:int c:word(6)
write (In)Correct
data.inputDescription:
<<First line>> : the number [[N]] of cards in the pile.
<<[[N]] next lines>> : a number [[v]] and a color [[c]], standing for a card
data.outputDescription:
"{{Correct}}" if the card were played correctly.
Else, "{{Incorrect}}:[[e]]", with [[e]] the number of mistakes made.
